intro: Syncodon, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers. Syncodon species typically have narrow, linear leaves and produce small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. They are often found in sandy or rocky soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
